question_stem: The line \(y = 3x - 1\) intersects the x-axis at point B.

parts.question_text: Write down the coordinates of B.
parts.solution_text: When the line intersects the x-axis, \(y = 0\). Substituting this into the equation of the line gives \(0 = 3x - 1\).  Solving for x, we get \(3x = 1\), so \(x = \frac{1}{3}\). Therefore, the coordinates of B are \((\frac{1}{3}, 0)\).
